result.heading: THE DEMON BARBER OF FLEET STREET

direction.raw_text: : THE DEMON BARBER OF FLEET STREET Written by John Logan Music and Lyrics by Stephen Sondheim Adapted from the Stage Musical "Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street" Music and Lyrics by Stephen Sondheim Book by Hugh Wheeler Based on a version of "Sweeney Todd" by Christopher Bond
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd. His skin was pale and his eye was odd. He shaved the faces of gentlemen Who never thereafter were heard of again. He trod a path that few have trod, Did Sweeney Todd, The Demon Barber of Fleet Street. We cut from the blood to see the Gentleman standing before us. Strangely impassive. We are in an eerie dark chamber, unclear, a low ceiling, a world of silhouettes and shadows. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 1   CONTINUED:                                                     1 Another figure emerges from the miasma of shadows, into the hellish flickering of flame: THE BANKER. He is large, rotund and sleek. Impressive muttonchops.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He kept a shop in London town, Of fancy clients and good renown, And what if none of their souls were saved? They went to their maker impeccably shaved... More FIGURES begin to emerge from the shadows, joining the Gentleman and the Banker as...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By Sweeney, By Sweeney Todd, The Demon Barber of Fleet Street. Although prosaic in appearance these figures are, in fact, GHOSTS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swing your razor wide, Sweeney! Hold it to the skies! Freely flows the blood of those Who moralize! As they continue, the new figures become more distinct... THE GENERAL, a tough, leather-skinned military man in a crimson imperial uniform...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His needs were few, his room was bare: THE PRIEST, a lean, severe man with pale skin in clerical attire...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A lavabo and a fancy chair... THE TOURIST, a small, meek man with glasses in an ill-fitting suit...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A mug of suds and a leather strop, An apron, a towel, a pail and a mop... THE STUDENT, a dashing young man from Oxford with luxurious long hair... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 1   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For neatness he deserves a nod, Does Sweeney Todd...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street. The ghosts are a bit more insinuating now as they move around this mysterious world...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (variously) Inconspicuous Sweeney was, Quick and quiet and clean `e was. Back of his smile, under his word, Sweeney heard music that nobody heard. Sweeney pondered and Sweeney planned, Like a perfect machine 'e planned, Sweeney was smooth, Sweeney was subtle, Sweeney would blink and rats would scuttle... The specters are becoming more insistent, their strange impassivity giving way to accusation as the flickering red flame becomes an inferno--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (variously) Sweeney was smooth, Sweeney was subtle, Sweeney would blink and rats would scuttle. Inconspicuous Sweeney was, Quick and quiet and clean 'e was, Like a perfect machine 'e was, Was Sweeney! Sweeney! Sweeney! Sweeeeeneeeeey! On this explosive note we revolve -- away from the ghostly Furies-- To discover-- SWEENEY TODD. Standing before us. An unclear figure, silhouetted in blazing red flames. We slowly push in on him as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd. He served a dark and a vengeful god. What happened then-- (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 1   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, who's to say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And he wouldn't want us to give it away,
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (variously) Not Sweeney, Not Sweeney Todd, The Demon Barber of Fleet Street. On this note, we push in tight on the figure of Todd... Music and the clanging of a clock tower bell are heard as we slowly begin pulling back and are imperceptibly transported to... 2   EXT. SHIP -- THAMES -- ALMOST DAWN                             2 ANTHONY, a young sailor of about 20, is standing at the rail of a ship. We see the obscure shape of rigging and sails behind him. The cries of sailors echo. Behind him stand the GENTLEMAN and the BANKER. They are looking past Anthony, looking at something. They move away as Anthony peers through the fog, straining to see... London. Gradually, as the ship approaches, the towering spires and mountainous rooftops of the city begin to stand out in relief, to emerge through the fog like a tiger creeping toward its prey. Music continues as Anthony takes in the dreadful and magnificent spectacle of the 19th Century metropolis. The gnarl of rooftops. The labyrinth of streets and alleys. The black trails of smoke reaching up like skeletal fingers from a thousand chimneys. London. Sulfurous London. Anthony is awestruck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have sailed the world, beheld its wonders From the Dardanelles To the mountains of Peru, But there's no place like London--! Then-- (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 2   CONTINUED:                                                    2 Sweeney Todd steps to Anthony's side, grimly interrupting--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, there's no place like London.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Todd...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You are young. Life has been kind to you. You will learn. Todd's glares forward, his haunted gaze never leaving the approaching city. 3   EXT. DOCKS -- DAWN                                             3 Music continues as Todd stands very still and takes in the shadowy figures on the docks. Anthony seems almost lost at his side, overwhelmed by the scale and aura of the city.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lord ... takes your breath away, doesn't it? Todd shudders violently, almost snarling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a hole in the world Like a great black pit And the vermin of the world Inhabit it And its morals aren't worth What a pig could spit And it goes by the name Of London. At the top of the hole Sit the privileged few Making mock of the vermin In the lower zoo, Turning beauty into filth and greed. I too Have sailed the world, and seen its wonders For the cruelty of men Is as wondrous as Peru, But there's no place like London! Anthony looks at his friend, mystified by his grim reaction to the city. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 3   CONTINUED:                                                    3 TODD I beg your indulgence, Anthony ... My mind is far from easy. In these once familiar streets I feel shadows everywhere...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Shadows...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ghosts. Anthony looking at him, questioning. Todd continues quietly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was a barber and his wife, And she was beautiful, A foolish barber and his wife, She was his reason and his life, And she was beautiful, And she was virtuous. And he was... (a breath) Naive. Anthony watches, rapt, as Todd remembers... 4   EXT. FLOWER MARKET -- FLASHBACK -- DAY                         4 ...Fifteen years before. Todd walks with his beautiful wife LUCY through a crowded flower market, a colorful explosion of blossoms. Lucy carries their one-year-old baby, JOHANNA. Todd is almost unrecognizable to us, content and smiling. Chatting with his wife. Happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was another man who saw That she was beautiful, A pious vulture of the law, Who with a gesture of his claw Removed the barber from his plate. Then there was nothing but to wait And she would fall, So soft, So young, So lost, And oh, so beautiful! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 4   CONTINUED:                                                    4 During the above, JUDGE TURPIN, an elderly man with a saturnine demeanor, eyes Lucy through the luxurious bunches of flowers. He stalks her, desiring her. With the Judge is his nefarious creature, BEADLE BAMFORD. The Beadle is a large man, his florid nature and pink, powdered face never quite disguising his lethality. The Judge whispers to the Beadle, indicating Todd. Then the Beadle and several policemen sweep in and drag Todd off. The Judge moves in on Lucy like a predator. And we return to... 5   EXT. DOCKS -- DAWN                                             5 Music continues.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the lady, sir ... did she succumb?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, that was many years ago... I doubt if anyone would know. A quiet beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I owe you my life, Anthony. If you hadn't spotted me, I would be lost on the ocean still ... Thank you. Todd picks up his duffel bag, preparing to go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will I see you again?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You might find me, if you like, around Fleet Street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Until then, my friend. He offers his hand. Todd takes it and shakes. Then Todd quickly turns and goes. Anthony stands for a moment, saddened by the mysterious pall that hangs over his friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 6   EXT. STREET -- MORNING                                         6 Todd strides along, deep in thought. The emotions roiling within him finally seethe out in a dark mutter:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a hole in the world Like a great black pit And it's filled with people Who are filled with shit And the vermin of the world Inhabit it... He disappears down the street as the music THUNDERS-- 7   EXT. LONDON ASSAULT -- DAY                                     7 --We ZOOM ahead of Todd -- cutting through the city at lightning pace down twisting alleys and up crowded boulevards -- into tunnels and over bridges -- slashing through London at breakneck speed -- the insane explosion of music sending us hurtling to-- 8   EXT. THE PIE SHOP -- DAY                                       8 Fleet Street. We see the exterior of Mrs. Lovett's pie shop. It is tatty and unloved by all. Yet it has a strange, ghostly presence to it. Imposing and dead at the same time. There is an exterior staircase leading up to a darkened second floor room with a window overlooking the street. The music slows and continues as we see Todd, standing in front of the shop, considering it deeply. The GENERAL we saw before passes, glancing at Todd. Here and then gone. Todd finally strides to the shop and enters... 9   INT. PIE SHOP -- DAY                                           9 Behind the dusty counter is... MRS. LOVETT, a venal, vigorous and slatternly woman in her 40's. She is currently busy chopping a loathsome mess of suet with a wicked looking knife, her greasy hair hanging down over her face. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 9   CONTINUED:                                                    9 The moment Todd enters -- and the bell at the door sounds -- her head snaps up and her eyes are on him like a bird of prey:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A customer! Todd is startled, starts to go--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! What's yer rush? What's yer hurry? (She sticks the knife into the counter) You gave me such a-- (Wipes her hands on her apron) ) Fright. I thought you was a ghost. Half a minute, can'tcher? Sit! Sit ye down! (An order) Sit! (He obeys) All I meant is that I Haven't seen a customer for weeks. Did you come here for a pie, sir? (Todd nods. She flicks a bit of dust off a pie with a rag) Do forgive me if me head's a little vague-- Ugh! (She plucks something off the pie, examines it) What is that? But you'd think we had the plague-- (She drops it on the floor and stamps on it) From the way that people-- (She flicks something off the pie with her finger) Keep avoiding-- (Spotting it moving) No, you don't! (She smacks it with her hand) Heaven knows I try, sir! (Lifts her hand, looks at it) Tsk! (She wipes it on the edge of the counter) But there's no one comes in even to inhale-- (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 9   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tsk! (She blows the last dust off the pie as she brings it to him) Right you are, sir. Would you like a drop of ale? (Todd nods) Mind you, I can't hardly blame them-- (Pouring a tankard of ale) These are probably the worst pies in London. I know why nobody cares to take them-- I should know, I make them. But good? No, The worst pies in London-- Even that's polite. The worst pies in London-- If you doubt it, take a bite. (He does. It's horrible) Is that just disgusting? You have to concede it. It's nothing but crusting-- Here, drink this, you'll need it-- (She gives him the ale) The worst pies in London. During the following, she slams lumps of dough on the counter and rolls them out, grunting frequently as she goes:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And no wonder with the price of meat What it is-- (Grunt) When you get it. (Grunt) Never (Grunt) Thought I'd live to see the day Men'd think it was a treat Finding poor (Grunt) Animals (Grunt) Wot are dying in the street. Mrs. Mooney has a pie shop, Does a business, but I noticed something weird-- Lately all her neighbors' cats have disappeared. (Shrugs) Have to hand it to her-- Wot I calls Enterprise, Popping pussies into pies. Wouldn't do in my shop-- Just the thought of it's enough to make you sick. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 9    CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I'm telling you them pussy cats is quick. (Leans on counter, exhausted) No denying times is hard, sir -- Even harder than The worst pies in London. Only lard and nothing more-- (As Todd gamely tries another mouthful) Is that just revolting? All greasy and gritty, It looks like it's molting, And tastes like-- Well, pity A woman alone With limited wind And the worst pies in London! (Sighs heavily) Ah sir, Times is hard. Times is hard. She finishes one of the crusts with a flourish as the music ends. Todd, meanwhile, is gulping at his ale, trying to wash down Mrs. Lovett's hideous creation.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trust me, dearie, it's going to take more than ale to wash that taste out. Come with me and we'll get you a nice tumbler of gin. She leads him through the curtains at the back of the pie shop and into... 10   INT. PARLOR -- DAY                                            10 ... Her parlor is a wonder of seedy faux-middle class Victoriana. Little knickknacks, dusty plants and dingy doilies. There is a threadbare mauve sofa in front of a comfortable fire. A faded picture postcard of the seaside hangs on a wall. She goes to a sideboard and pours him a huge glass of gin as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't this homey now? Me cheery wallpaper was a real bargain too, it being only partly singed when the chapel burnt down .... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 10   CONTINUED:                                                    10 She hands him the gin. He gulps it down, washing the taste of her pie out of his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a good boy, now you sit down and warm your bones, you look chilled through. He sits before the fire:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Isn't that a room over the shop? If times are so hard, why don't you rent it out? She glances up at the roof, considering the room over them.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Up there? Oh, no one will go near it... She turns to him, something a little intense and probing about her gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: People think it's haunted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Haunted? She holds his gaze.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And who's to say they're wrong? ... You see, years ago, something happened up there. Something not very nice... The flickering flame from the fire begins to cast a more intense red glow on her face...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was a barber and his wife, And he was beautiful, A proper artist with a knife, But they transported him for life. (Sighs) And he was beautiful... The music continues as she looks at him, again with that rather intense gaze: (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 10   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barker, his name was -- Benjamin Barker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Transported? What was his crime?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (with an edge) Foolishness. She turns again to the fire, the red glow bathing her face as she remembers... 11   INT. BARBER SHOP -- FLASHBACK -- DAY                          11 Lucy is pacing, holding Baby Johanna to her closely. Lucy is distraught, strained, tears in her eyes. As Lucy paces we notice the room is full of dead and dying flowers: dozens of dried bouquets tossed aside and ignored.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He had this wife, you see, Pretty little thing, Silly little nit Had her chance for the moon on a string-- Poor thing. Poor thing. Lucy moves to the window, looks out. She sees Judge Turpin and the Beadle waiting below. The Judge holds yet another bouquet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was this Judge, you see, Wanted her like mad, Every day he'd send her a flower, But did she come down from her tower? Sat up there and sobbed by the hour, Poor fool. Lucy moves away from the window, sobbing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, but there was worse yet to come, Poor thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 12   EXT. EXCLUSIVE STREET -- FLASHBACK -- EVENING                 12 The Beadle is leading a nervous Lucy along an exclusive street of dark stone mansions, grand but somehow menacing. Lucy is wearing her best dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Beadle calls on her, all polite, Poor thing, poor thing. The Judge, he tells her, is all contrite, He blames himself for her dreadful plight She must come straight to his house tonight! Poor thing, poor thing. 13   INT. TURPIN'S MANSION -- BALLROOM -- FLASHBACK -- NIGHT       13 The Beadle ushers Lucy into a ballroom. She is shocked to see a fancy-dress ball in progress. Masked couples swirl around the ballroom, their number sinisterly multiplied by the distorting mirrors that frame the room. The hanging chandeliers, draped in red cloth, cast a disquieting incarnadine glow on the proceedings...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course, when she goes there, Poor thing, poor thing, They're having this ball all in masks. Lucy wanders lost through the swirling dancers, they buffet her, confusing her...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's no one she knows there, Poor dear, poor thing, She wanders tormented, and drinks, Poor thing. The Judge has repented, she thinks, Poor thing. "Oh, where is Judge Turpin?" she asks. The Beadle finds Lucy again and graciously gives her his arm, leading her through the party. She is thankful for the salvation he provides. He brings her to Judge Turpin. The Judge descends on Lucy, raping her. The other guests crowd around ravenously, enjoying the spectacle. A feverish nightmare.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was there, all right-- Only not so contrite! She wasn't no match for such craft, you see, (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 13   CONTINUED:                                                     13 And everyone thought it so droll. They figured she had to be daft, you see, So all of `em stood there and laughed, you see, Poor soul! Poor thing!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...! Todd's wild howl shatters the memory and tears us back to-- 14   INT. PARLOR -- DAY                                             14 --Todd is bolting up from the sofa, tormented--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ..... NOOOOOO! He stands for a terrible beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would no one have mercy on her?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So it is you -- Benjamin Barker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where's Lucy?! Where's my wife?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She poisoned herself. Arsenic from the apothecary on the corner. I tried to stop her but she wouldn't listen to me. And he's got your daughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He? Judge Turpin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Adopted her like his own. Todd absorbs this sickening news.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fifteen years of sweating in a living hell on a false charge. Fifteen years dreaming that I might come home to find a loving wife and child... A beat as he stares into the fire, madness and purpose creeping in. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 14   CONTINUED:                                                    14 MRS. LOVETT Well, I can't say the years have been particularly kind to you, Mr. Barker, but you still--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, not Barker. That man is dead. It's Todd now. Sweeney Todd ... And he will have his revenge. He continues with a chilling and quiet resolve as he stares with unblinking eyes into the fire:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Judge Turpin and the Beadle will pay for what they did. A beat. He finally turns to her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: First I must have my shop back. 15   EXT. PIE SHOP -- DAY                                           15 They emerge from the pie shop. She begins to scale the exterior staircase to the darkened second floor room. He hesitates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come along... She continues up, he slowly follows. 16   INT. BARBER SHOP -- DAY                                        16 A macabre shroud of dust and spider's webs. Furniture covered in sheets. A broken mirror on one wall. We hear footsteps approaching and then Mrs. Lovett enters. The door creaks like a living thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not to worry, a touch of oil will put that right. (she turns back to Todd) ... Nothing to be afraid of, love, come in. She moves into the room. But Todd hesitates at the door, looking into the room. For him this is a truly haunted place. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 16   CONTINUED:                                                   16 Meanwhile, she kneels and pries loose a floorboard. Underneath there is a hidden area. Within that, something covered with a velvet cloth. She removes it and carefully unwraps it. Her touch is particularly gentle and respectful. We discover it is a fine leather case. She looks at it for a beat. Then turns to him, dusting it off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't believe it... He finally steps into the room, drawn toward the case.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When they came for the girl, I hid 'em. I thought, who knows? Maybe the silly blighter'll be back again. Cracked in the head, wasn't I? Haunting music begins as she opens the case... And we see it contains a beautiful set of razors. He stands for a long moment, gazing down at his beloved razors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Those handles is chased silver, ain't they?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silver, yes... These are my friends, See how they glisten. (He picks up a small razor) See this one shine, How he smiles in the light. My friend, my faithful friend. (Holding it to his ear, feeling the edge with his thumb) ) Speak to me friend, Whisper, I'll listen. (Listening) I know, I know-- You've been locked out of sight All these years-- Like me, my friend. Well, I've come home To find you waiting. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 16   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Home, And we're together, And we'll do wonders, Won't we? Mrs. Lovett leans over him, in her own kind of trance as well. They now sing simultaneously:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (Picking out a larger razor) You there, my friend, Come, let me hold you. Now, with a sigh You grow warm In my hand, My friend, My clever friend. (Putting it back) Rest now, my friends. Soon I'll unfold you. Soon you'll know splendors You never have dreamed All your days--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm your friend too, Mr. Todd. If you only knew, Mr. Todd-- Ooh, Mr. Todd, You're warm In my hand. You've come home. Always had a fondness for you, I did.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --My lucky friends. Till now your shine Was merely silver. Friends, You shall drip rubies, You'll soon drip precious Rubies...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never you fear, Mr. Todd, You can move in here, Mr. Todd. Splendors you never have dreamed All your days Will be yours. I'm your friend. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 16   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And you're mine. Don't they shine beautiful? Silver's good enough for me, Mr. T... The music continues quietly as Todd stares at one of his razors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave me now... She goes. Todd finally picks up his biggest razor and slowly opens it, looks at it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At last my arm is complete again. And he remains standing. Exalted. Then-- In the shattered mirror on the wall he suddenly sees-- The distorted reflections of the Gentleman, the Banker, and the General, looking at him--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lift your razor high, Sweeney! Hear it singing, "Yes!" Sink it in the rosy skin Of righteousness! Todd turns to them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (variously) His voice was soft, his manner mild. He seldom laughed but he often smiled, He'd seen how civilized men behave. He never forgot and he never forgave, Not Sweeney, Not Sweeney Todd, The Demon Barber of Fleet Street. Todd pulls a sheet off Baby Johanna's cradle. A cloud of dust rises. The ghosts disappear in the cloud of dust and Todd stands alone, staring at the cradle, holding his razor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 17   EXT. EXCLUSIVE STREET -- DAY                                  17 Anthony, now out of his sailor's uniform, is walking along the sidewalk near the Judge's mansion, absorbed in a copy of Baedeker's London. He stops, lost, trying to get his bearings, studying his map. Then an unusual sound emerges through the normal cosmopolitan bustle. It is the sound of a woman humming. He looks up to see... JOHANNA, a 16-year-old girl with golden hair, beautiful and hauntingly sad. She sits at her window above, behind bars, humming to herself as she does needlepoint. Anthony watches her, absolutely mesmerized. Johanna notices a Bird Seller passing. He carries a long, wooden pole with little bird cages attached.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Green finch and linnet bird, Nightingale, blackbird, How is it you sing? How can you jubilate, Sitting in cages, Never taking wing? Outside the sky waits, Beckoning, beckoning, Just beyond the bars. How can you remain, Staring at the rain, Maddened by the stars? How is it you sing Anything? How is it you sing? Then ... she sees Anthony on the sidewalk below. Music continues. There is a long look between them. Her intense, melancholy expression moves him. She continues singing, the strange anguish and yearning of her words seem intended only for him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My cage has many rooms, Damask and dark. Nothing there sings, Not even my lark. Larks never will, you know, When they're captive. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 17   CONTINUED:                                                     17 Teach me to be more adaptive. Green finch and linnet bird, Nightingale, blackbird, Teach me how to sing. If I cannot fly, Let me sing. Then she turns away quickly, alarmed, when someone enters her room. She looks terrified. Below, Anthony is concerned for her. He sees her move from the window. He is craning to see better when a BEGGAR WOMAN -- a filthy tendril of a woman, her foul clothes of rags like a second skin -- suddenly thrusts her arm up from the curb, imploring:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alms! ... Alms! ... For a miserable woman On a miserable chilly morning... (Anthony drops a coin into her hand) Thank yer, sir, thank yer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ma'am, could tell me whose house this is?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the great Judge Turpin's house that is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the young lady who resides there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's Johanna, his pretty little ward. Keeps her snug, he does, all locked up ... So don't you go trespassing there or it's a good whipping for you -- or any other young man with mischief on his mind... She suddenly leers into a lewd and demented assault:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Ow would you like a little muff, dear, A little jig jig A little bounce around the bush? Wouldn't you like to push me parsley? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 17   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It looks to me, dear, Like you got plenty there to push. She grabs at Anthony's crotch -- Anthony starts back -- she turns away, instantly plaintive again, and appeals to other pedestrians as she goes:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alms! ... Alms!... For a desperate woman... Anthony considers the mansion. He sees a figure standing at a window, unclear behind the shutters, watching him. He sits on a bench outside the mansion and sings quietly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I feel you, Johanna, I feel you. I was half convinced I'd waken, Satisfied enough to dream you. Happily I was mistaken, Johanna! I'll steal you, Johanna, I'll steal you... Then the figure disappears from the window above. Anthony stands, waits. Then the doors to the mansion swing open... Anthony is expecting Johanna... But it is Judge Turpin, the predator we met in Todd's flashback, who steps into the doorway. He seems a different man now. Paternal and warm, he smiles and beckons to Anthony. Anthony hesitates, unsure. The Judge beckons again. Again the warm smile.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come in, lad. Come in... Anthony goes into the mansion. 18   INT. TURPIN'S MANSION -- LIBRARY -- DAY                       18 Judge Turpin leads Anthony into the dark library, filled with books. Anthony is looking around for Johanna. He is wary, this is all very strange. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 18   CONTINUED:                                                    18 JUDGE ... you were looking for Hyde Park, you say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, it's terribly large on the map but I keep getting lost...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit down, lad, sit down. Anthony sits, uncomfortable, as the Judge pours two snifters of brandy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's embarrassing for a sailor to lose his bearings, but, well, there you are. Then... The large form of the Beadle appears from the shadows. No introduction is made. Anthony glances to him, uneasy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sailor, eh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir. The "Bountiful" out of Plymouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sailor must know the ways of the world, yes? ... Must be practiced in the ways of the world ... Would you say you are practiced, boy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir? The Judge moves to consider some beautiful volumes, bound in the richest leather. He runs a finger along the spines of the books; his large library of pornography.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, yes ... such practices ... the geishas of Japan ... the concubines of Siam .. the catamites of Greece ... the harlots of India ... I have them all here ... Drawings of them .... (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 18   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (he turns again to Anthony) ... All the vile things you've done with your whores. Anthony is speechless. The Judge just smiles at him amiably.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to see?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (standing) I think there's been some mistake--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I think not. You gandered at my ward, Johanna ... You gandered at her ... Yes, sir, you gandered. The Beadle moves behind Anthony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (glancing nervously back at the Beadle) I meant no harm--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your meaning is immaterial. Mark me: if I see your face again on this street, you'll rue the day your bitch of a mother gave you birth. Anthony is stunned. The Judge proceeds with shocking venom:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My Johanna isn't one of your bloody cock-chafers! My Johanna is not to be gandered at! He nods to the Beadle -- the Beadle instantly grabs Anthony and brutally hauls him out. 19   EXT. MANSION -- ALLEY -- DAY                                  19 The Beadle drags Anthony through a rear door of the mansion and flings him into a filthy alley. Anthony pulls himself up. Stunned.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hyde Park is that way, young sir ... A right and then a left, then straight on, you see? ... (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 19   CONTINUED:                                                    19 BEADLE (cont'd) (points) ... Over there. Flustered, Anthony turns to look-- The instant Anthony's back is turned, the Beadle swings his lethal billyclub and SLAMS him from behind brutally, in the kidneys -- Anthony's knees buckle-- The Beadle then SLAMS Anthony across the back of the neck -- Anthony falls hard-- The Beadle then uses one dainty foot to roll Anthony over-- Anthony gazes up at him, panting for breath, in agony--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You heard Judge Turpin, little man. He presses the end of his billyclub into Anthony's forehead, grinding it hard--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Next time it'll be your pretty brains all over the pavement. With that, the Beadle returns to the mansion and slams the door. Anthony slowly pulls himself to his knees, doubled over, coughing up blood. A long beat as Anthony gets his breath, wiping blood from his face. Still doubled over, he sings with burning intensity:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll steal you, Johanna, I'll steal you! Do they think that walls can hide you? Even now I'm at your window. I am in the dark beside you, Buried sweetly in your yellow hair. He pulls himself up, every movement is agony. He makes his way down the alley, leaning on the wall for support. 20   EXT. EXCLUSIVE STREET -- DAY                                   20 The music swells as Anthony emerges from the dark alley into the bright sunlight. He makes his way along the sidewalk: (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 20   CONTINUED:                                                    20 ANTHONY I feel you, Johanna, And one day I'll steal you. Till I'm with you then, I'm with you there, Sweetly buried in your yellow hair... The soaring music continues as Anthony stops at a park across the street from Turpin's mansion, bravely gazing up at Johanna's window. 21   EXT. STREET LEADING TO ST. DUNSTAN'S MARKETPLACE -- DAY        21 Sweeney Todd and Mrs. Lovett are moving quickly, she struggles to keep up with his long, loping stride. He carries his razor case, she carries a shopping basket.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's here every Thursday?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like clockwork. Eyetalian. All the rage he is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not for long. 22   EXT. ST. DUNSTAN'S MARKETPLACE            DAY                  22 They round a corner and move into the bustling marketplace. A steady mercantile hum as the cries of merchants and wandering coster-mongers fill the air. Todd and Mrs. Lovett move toward a hand-drawn caravan dominating one corner of the marketplace. It is painted like a Sicilian donkey cart and on its side a sign declaims: "Signor Adolfo Pirelli -- Haircutter to His Royal Majesty the King of Naples."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh Mr. T., do you really think you can do it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By tomorrow they'll all be flocking to me like sheep to be shorn-- He stops abruptly when he sees-- The Beadle casually strolling through the crowd. Todd is transfixed, his ancient enemy so close. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 22   CONTINUED:                                                   22 MRS. LOVETT (seeing the Beadle, pulling his arm) Come along now, dear, he might recognize you--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I will do what I have vowed to do ... (he continues to glare at the Beadle, his voice low) ... Come closer, my friend, closer... Then, TOBY -- a 13-year-old boy, a bit small for his age, malnourished and consumptively pale -- emerges from Pirelli's caravan. He bangs on a tin drum, drawing customers. A crowd begins to gather at the caravan as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ladies and gentlemen! May I have your attention, perlease? Do you wake every morning in shame and despair To discover your pillow is covered with hair Wot ought not to be there? Well, ladies and gentlemen, From now on you can waken at ease. You need never again have a worry or care, I will show you a miracle marvelous rare, Gentlemen, you are about to see something wot rose from the dead! (A woman gasps, he smiles and wiggles a finger no) On the top of my head. He dramatically doffs his cap, revealing mountains of hair which cascade to his shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Twas Pirelli's Miracle Elixir, That's wot did the trick, sir, True, sir, true. Was it quick, sir? Did it in a tick, sir? Just like an elixir Ought to do! (To a Bald Man) How about a bottle, mister? Only costs a penny, guaranteed. (Pours a drop on the bald man's head) Does Pirelli's (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 22   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stimulate the growth, sir? You can have my oath, sir, 'Tis unique. (Applies the bald man's hand to the wet spot) Rub a minute, Stimulatin', i'n it? Soon you'll have to thin it Once a week! More customers are stepping up and buying bottles. Todd opens a bottle of the Elixir, takes a whiff. Disgusting. He smiles to Mrs. Lovett, his plan falling into place.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (loudly, to Mrs. Lovett) Pardon me, ma'am, what's that awful stench?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are we standing near an open trench?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to a woman in the crowd) Must be standing near an open trench! The crowd responds to Todd and Mrs. Lovett, looking askance and sniffing at the bottles. Toby nervously tries to distract them:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Buy Pirelli's Miracle Elixir: Anything wot's slick, sir, Soon sprouts curls. Try Pirelli's! When they see how thick, sir, You can have your pick, sir, Of the girls! Want to buy a bottle, missus?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sniffing bottle of Elixir) What is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (sniffing another customer's bottle) What is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smells like piss. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 22   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Smells like -- phew!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is piss. Piss with ink. The music speeds up -- Toby is getting desperate:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let Pirelli's Activate your roots, sir--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Keep it off your boots, sir-- Eats right through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, get Pirelli's! Use a bottle of it! Ladies seem to love it--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flies do too! Suddenly, the curtains on the caravan are dramatically flung wide to reveal-- PIRELLI, a flamboyant Italian with a velvet suit, thick wavy hair and a dazzling smile. Pirelli poses splendidly for a moment. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am Adolfo Pirelli, Da king of da barbers, da barber of kings, E buon giorno, good day, I blow you a kiss! (he does so) And I, da so-famous Pirelli, I wish-a to know-a Who has-a da nerve-a to say My elixir is piss! Who says this?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I do. (Todd moves forward boldly.) I am Mr. Sweeney Todd of Fleet Street. I have opened a bottle of Pirelli's elixir, and I say to you that it is nothing but an arrant fraud, concocted from piss and ink. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 22   CONTINUED: (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And furthermore --   "signor" -- I have serviced no kings,   yet I wager I can shave a cheek with   ten times more dexterity that any   street mountebank. He snaps open his razor case and holds it up for the crowd to see, turning to display the wondrous razors:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see these razors?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to the crowd) The finest in England.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (glaring at Pirelli) I lay them against five pounds you are no match for me. You hear me, sir? Either accept my challenge or reveal yourself as a sham.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bravo, bravo. The crowd is enjoying this now, whispering eagerly about the bold challenge. In the crowd, we see a quick flash of the meek TOURIST we saw earlier. Pirelli studies the razors for a moment and then turns to the crowd with a confident smile:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You hear zis foolish man? Watch and see how he will regret his folly! Music begins as Todd moves into action, preparing the challenge:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Friends, who's for a free shave? Two men step forward. A plain wooden chair is brought for Todd as he moves into the boldest part of this plan... He carefully turns to ... The Beadle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will Beadle Bamford be the judge? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 22   CONTINUED: (5)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glad, as always, to oblige my friends and neighbors (to the crowd) ... Let the challenge commence! One man sits in Todd's plain chair as the other moves to an elaborate chair on Pirelli's caravan. Pirelli shakes out a fancy bib with a flourish and covers his man. Toby prepares Pirelli's ornate shaving supplies as Todd takes a plain towel and tucks it around his man's neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ready?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ready!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ready.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The fastest, smoothest shave is the winner. He blows his shrill whistle. Agitated music begins. Pirelli strops his razor quickly, Todd in a leisurely manner. Pirelli keeps glancing at Todd in various paranoid ways throughout, frightened of Todd's progress. He starts whipping up lather rapidly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (while mixing furiously) Now, signorini, signori, We mix-a da lather But first-a you gather Around, signorini, signori, You looking a man (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 22   CONTINUED: (6)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who have had-a da glory To shave-a da Pope. Mr. Sweeney-so-smart-- (Splatters the customer with shaving cream) Oh, I beg-a you pardon -- 'll Call me a lie, was-a only a cardinal-- Nope! It was-a da Pope! Unexpectedly, Todd still shows no signs of starting to shave his man. He merely watches Pirelli's performance. Mrs. Lovett looks at him nervously, wishing he would get on with it. Pirelli, now feeling he can take his time, sings lyrically as he lathers and shaves with rhythmic scrapes and elaborate gestures of wiping the razor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To shave-a da face, To cut-a da hair, Require da grace Require da flair, For if-a you slip, You nick da skin, You clip-a da chin, You rip-a da lip a bit Beyond-a repair! Todd strops his razor slowly and deliberately -- shoop, shoop, shoop -- disconcerting Pirelli and drawing the crowd's attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To shave-a da face Or even a part Widout it-a smart Require da heart. Not just-a da flash, It take-a panache, It take-a da passion For da art. Todd is unconcerned. He just continues to slowly strop his razor -- shoop, shoop, shoop -- which flusters Pirelli.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To shave-a da face, To trim-a da beard, To make-a da bristle Clean like a whistle, Dis is from early infancy Da talent give to me (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 22   CONTINUED: (7)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By God! (Crosses   himself with his razor) It take-a da   skill, It take-a da   brains, It take-a da   will To take-a da   pains, It take-a da   pace, It take-a da   graaaaaace... While Pirelli holds this note elaborately, Todd, with a few deft strokes, quickly lathers his man's face, shaves him and signals the Beadle to examine him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (blowing whistle) The winner is Todd. Pirelli deflates.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (feeling the customer's cheek) Smooth as a baby's arse! -- (to Todd) - - Well done, dear! The crowd laughs and applauds Todd as Pirelli goes to him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a profound bow) Sir, I bow to a skill far defter than my own.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The five pounds. Pirelli produces a distinctive chatelaine purse and removes a five pound note, gives it to Todd:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here, sir. And may the good Lord smile on you -- (a quick stab of a smile)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: th DECEMBER, 2006 PAGE 1. 1   INT. DARK CHAMBER -- NIGHT                                     1 Foreboding organ music is heard... We are looking down at a rough brick floor ... is it an alley? ... a cobblestone street? ... a warehouse? a factory? ... we're not sure... The flickering glow of flame is the only illumination... The ominous organ music continues as... From the bottom of the frame... A dark pool of blood slowly begins to spread ... moving up the frame, defying gravity ... the flickering flame reflected in the blood... Finally, the pool of blood fills the entire frame. SUDDENLY-- A shrill factory whistle blows-- ENORMOUSLY LOUD -- blood-chilling and spine-shattering -- the whistle is a bizarre combination of sound: a factory whistle; a hog being slaughtered; a dog snarling; a roaring inferno; a human scream-- And a man's face appears, upside down, reflected in the pool of blood. He is THE GENTLEMAN, a slender dandy in pearl grey gloves and matching waistcoat. A cold and superior aristocrat. The camera slowly revolves -- the Gentleman becoming right side up as--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The crowd gasps. Pirelli is about to respond, outraged, but Todd continues--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mrs. Lovett's eyes shoot to Todd, alarmed-- The Beadle moves toward Todd .... Todd smiles amiably, but quivers internally at being so dreadfully close to his prey... Mrs. Lovett watches, concerned. Will the Beadle recognize the features of Benjamin Barker...? Apparently not. The Beadle stops right before Todd and smiles.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Until we meet again. He bows his head quickly and then moves away, beckoning to Toby:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come, boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're pulling out, sir? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 22   CONTINUED: (8)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (snarling) We're pulling out, yes. Quickly. Mrs. Lovett has observed all of this as she moves away with Todd, who is making his way inexorably toward the Beadle. Some eager customers surround Todd, among them is the TOURIST.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Todd, sir, do you have an establishment of your own? Mrs. Lovett is on him like a hawk:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He certainly does. Sweeney Todd's Tonsorial Parlor -- above my meatpie emporium in Fleet Street. Todd has led them right to the Beadle:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I thank you for your honest adjudication, sir. You are a paragon of integrity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, I try to do my best for my friends and neighbors ... Your establishment is in Fleet Street, you say?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then, Mr. Todd, you will surely see me there before the week is out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You will be welcome, Beadle Bamford, and I guarantee to give you, without a penny's charge, the closest shave you will ever know.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 23   EXT. STREET -- DAY                                            23 Todd and Mrs. Lovett are walking away from the marketplace. She chatters happily:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Like to give me a coronary right there! What if he had recognized you! Lord, my heart was beating a mile a minute, just like a little finch it was. Aren't those lovely birds now? Always so twittery and happy... She continues chattering... But Todd is not listening. His eyes dart to the side to see-- The Gentleman is walking next to him, whispering, subtle, insinuating...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sweeney pondered and Sweeney planned. Like a perfect machine 'e planned... The Banker moves in next to the Gentleman...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Barbing the hook, baiting the trap, Setting it out for the Beadle to snap... The General joins them...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slyly courted 'im, Sweeney did, Set a sort of a scene 'e did...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laying the trail, showing the traces, Letting it lead to higher places... Sweeney... The last word echoes ... And then they are gone ... disappearing from Todd's mind ... swallowed up by the crowd of pedestrians... Todd looks to Mrs. Lovett and she continues chattering: (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 23   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Suppose it's just me gentle heart, but I do hate to see a boy treated like that, no better than your Aunt Doreen's dog -- Mr. Todd, are you listening to me?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course. But then his eyes dart again -- looking for the specters. He only sees strangers. 24   INT. JOHANNA'S ROOM -- MORNING                                24 Johanna sits, framed by the window, quietly cutting out silhouettes. Aimless Victorian handicrafts. But we see there are tears in her eyes. She steals a glance across the room. We see a small hole in the wallpaper. Through this hole, the Judge is watching her from another chamber. Lascivious. Perverse. Johanna finally stands and casually glances out from between the shutters at her window. She sees... Anthony, standing at the park across the street, keeping up his lonely vigil, gazing up at the mansion. She watches him for a moment and then makes her decision. She moves to a table and opens a drawer. Reaches in and removes something... 25   EXT. TURPIN'S MANSION -- MORNING                              25 Anthony sees a figure at the shutters -- then hears a clinking sound. Metal on pavement. He quickly moves across the street and looks... A key, dropped from above. He looks up to the shutters and smiles, then snatches up the key and hurries off. 26   INT. JOHANNA'S ROOM -- MORNING                                26 Peering through the shutters, Johanna watches him go. We linger on her face and then dissolve to another face, also watching...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 27   INT. BARBER SHOP -- MORNING                                  27 ... Her father. Todd's face, staring out the window, intense and brooding. Seething with discontent. Mrs. Lovett chatters as she moves around behind him:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... It's not much of a chair, I'll grant, but it'll serve. Was me poor Albert's chair. Sat in it all day long he did, after his leg give out from the gout, poor dear. He moves from the window and paces like a caged tiger in the small barber shop. Though it has been cleaned, it is still a spartan room. A tatty parlor chair. A large chest. A few counters with meager bottles of tonsorial supplies. And his gleaming razors, always waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why doesn't the Beadle come? "Before the week is out," that's what he said.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And who says the week's out? It's only Tuesday. Todd moves away from her, she pursues, trying to calm and soothe him...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy now. Hush, love, hush. Don't distress yourself, What's your rush? Keep your thoughts Nice and lush. Wait. (he continues to pace) Hush, love, hush. Think it through. Once it bubbles, Then what's to do? Watch it close. Let it brew. Wait. He does not respond. She dares to move closer... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 27   CONTINUED:                                                   27 MRS. LOVETT I've been thinking, flowers-- Maybe daisies-- To brighten up the room. Don't you think some flowers, Pretty daisies, Might relieve the gloom? Ah, wait, love, wait. Todd sourly tosses himself into the chair, he picks up his largest razor and looks at it intensely:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the Judge? When will we get to him?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't you think of nothing else? Always broodin' away on yer wrongs what happened heaven knows how many years ago... Don't you know, Silly man, Half the fun is to Plan the plan? All good things come to Those who can Wait. Her gentle words have calmed him considerably. She moves even closer. Risks touching him softly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gillyflowers, maybe, `Stead of daisies... I don't know, though... What do you think? Then Todd tilts the razor in his hand-- SUDDENLY -- the face of the GENTLEMAN -- a flash -- reflected in the razor-- Then-- A bell rings from outside the shop -- the effect is electric -- Todd bolts up, senses alert -- Mrs. Lovett spins to the door-- (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 27   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Todd! Thank God I've found you -- (Todd turns, closing the razor, as Anthony sees Mrs. Lovett) ... Oh, I'm sorry, excuse me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Lovett, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A pleasure, ma'am -- (continues to Todd)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Without warning, Pirelli SLAPS Toby viciously across the face --Toby almost falls--
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Todd holds his razor open as he moves strategically toward the door-- We hear footsteps ascending the stairs outside quickly-- Then-- Anthony enters, breathless--
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: You see, there's a girl who needs my help -- such a sad girl, and lonely, but beautiful too and--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slow down, Anthony.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (takes a breath) Yes, I'm sorry ... This girl has a guardian so tyrannical that he keeps her locked away. But then this morning she dropped this ... (produces the key) ... It must be a sign that Johanna wants me to help her -- that's her name, Johanna -- and Turpin that of her guardian. A judge of some sort... Todd and Mrs. Lovett exchange a quick glance as Anthony continues:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I've met him, Mr. Todd, and he is - - unnatural ... Once he goes to court, I'm going to slip into the house and release her -- and beg her to come away with me. Tonight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, this is all terribly romantic. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 27   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, but -- you see -- I don't know anyone in London -- (to Todd)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and I need somewhere safe to bring her till I've hired a coach to take us to Plymouth. He looks at Todd deeply:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If I could keep her here, just for an hour or two, I would forever be in your debt. Todd stares at him, his mind racing to figure out how this new twist might aid in his plans. It is Mrs. Lovett who smoothly replies:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bring her here, dear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, ma'am ... (to Todd) ... Mr. Todd? A beat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The girl may come.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, my friend. He goes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seems like the fates are favoring you at last, Mr. T. (Todd grunts, unhappy) What is it, love? You'll have her back before the day is out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: For a few hours? Before he carries her off to the other end of England? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 27   CONTINUED: (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, him? Let him bring her here and then, since you're so hot for a little
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (makes a throat-cutting gesture)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: that's the throat to slit, dear. Todd moves again to his post at the window, he stares out, deep in thought. Meanwhile, she happily moves around the shop, straightening things up and trying to make it all a bit more cozy:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Poor little Johanna. All those years without a scrap of motherly affection. Well, we'll soon see to that...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (alert, sees something) What's this? Mrs. Lovett joins him at the window. Below, they see Pirelli approaching with Toby in tow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Look at that face, he's up to mischief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go -- keep the boy below with you. She nods and scurries out. We go with her... 28   EXT. PIE SHOP -- DAY                                          28 ... Mrs. Lovett quickly moves down the steps outside the barber shop to greet Pirelli and Toby as they are about to ascend. We see a new sign on the stairs: "Sweeney Todd's Tonsorial Parlor."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Signora, is Mr. Todd at home?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Plying his trade upstairs, don'tcher know ... (she stands on the staircase, blocking their way, looking at Toby) (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 28   CONTINUED:                                                    28 MRS. LOVETT (cont'd) ... Would you look at it, now! Don't look like it's had a kind word since half past never!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ma'am...?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wouldn't mind if I gave him a nice juicy meat pie, would yer?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, yes, whatever you like. Pirelli climbs the stairs, as she takes Toby by the hand and leads him toward the pie shop door:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come with me now. Your teeth is strong, I hope? They go into the pie shop. 29   INT. BARBER SHOP -- DAY                                        29 Todd is standing, arms folded. Waiting. Pirelli enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Todd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Signor Pirelli.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Call me Danny. Daniel Higgins' the name when it's not professional ... I'd like me five quid back, if'n ya don't mind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because you entered into our little wager on false pretenses, me friend ... And so you might remember to be more forthright in the future, you'll be handing over half your profits to me, share and share alike... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 29   CONTINUED:                                                    29 Todd shakes his head, amused, and begins to turn away when Pirelli says:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Mr. Benjamin Barker. Todd freezes. 30   INT. PIE SHOP -- DAY                                           30 Mrs. Lovett hands Toby one of her grisly pies, he devours eagerly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's my boy, tuck in. But her attention is almost entirely on the roof above ... the muffled voices .... the sound of shoes walking... Her eyes keep darting up as she chatters distractedly with Toby:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like to see a man with a healthy appetite. Reminds me of my dear Albert, like to gorge himself to bloatation, he did. He didn't have your nice full head though--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To tell the truth -- (he pulls off the wig which covers his own short-cropped hair)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: it gets awful hot. 31   INT. BARBER SHOP -- DAY                                        31 Pirelli is expansively strolling around the shop, taking it all in, savoring every second:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... yes, this will do very nicely ... You don't remember me. Well, why should you? I was just a down and out Irish pug you hired for a couple of weeks -- sweeping up hair and the like
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But I remember these -- And how could I ever forget you, Benjamin Barker? (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 31   CONTINUED:                                                     31 PIRELLI (cont'd) I would sit right there and watch you, and dream of the day I could be a proper barber meself ... You might say you were an inspiration to me. Todd glares at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, do we have a deal, or should I run down the street for me pal Beadle Bamford? What do you say to that now, Mr. Sweeney T--? Without a word of warning-- Like a thunderbolt-- Todd is on him. He leaps across the shop and brutally grabs Pirelli by the neck -- violently strangling him -- Pirelli is surprisingly strong and puts up a desperate struggle -- they thump awkwardly around the shop-- 32   INT. PIE SHOP -- DAY                                            32 Mrs. Lovett hears the muffled sounds of the struggle above. She nervously begins to shift and clang some things around as she cleans the counter, trying to cover the sound, chattering:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My my my, always work to be done. Spic- and-span, that's my motto. Cleanliness is next to whatever-it-is. So, ah, how did you end up with that dreadful Eyetalian?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got me from the workhouse 'e did. Been there since I was born. Got no mum, got nobody. A wasted soul, that's what I am -- (a sudden, urgent thought)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh God! He's got an appointment with his tailor-- He bolts up, clearly terrified of Pirelli--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he's late, he'll blame me--! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 32   CONTINUED:                                                    32 MRS. LOVETT Wait--! But he is gone-- 33   EXT. PIE SHOP -- DAY                                           33 Toby vaults up the stairs to the barber shop-- 34   INT. BARBER SHOP -- DAY                                        34 Todd is standing calmly when Toby bursts in--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Signor, you got an appointment... He stops when he realizes Pirelli is nowhere to be seen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Signor Pirelli has been called away. You better run after him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no, sir. I better wait for him here or it'll be a lashing. He's a great one for the lashings. He moves past Todd to the large chest and sits-- Only now do we see one of Pirelli's hands protruding from the chest, dangling limply. Toby doesn't notice it. Todd at this moment, however, does. He smiles nervously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: So, hmmm, Mrs. Lovett gave you a pie, did she?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's a real lady. Model of all true Christian virtue. Then Pirelli's hand ... twitches. Toby doesn't notice. Todd does, stares at it anxiously.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That she is ... that she is. But if I know a growing boy, there's still room for some more pie, eh? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 34   CONTINUED:                                                    34 TOBY I'd say, sir -- (pats his stomach) -- An aching void. Pirelli's hand begins to twitch more desperately now, perilously close to where Toby's hand rests...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then why don't you run downstairs and wait for your master there? There'll be another pie in it for you, I'm sure... Pirelli's hand is twitching closer to Toby's now...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I should stay here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know   -- why don't you tell Mrs. Lovett   I said to give you a nice big tot of   gin?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gin, sir?! Thanking you kindly, sir! You're a Christian indeed! He races out happily and clatters down the stairs. A beat as Todd gets his breath. Then he goes to the trunk, leans down to open it, the camera follows him down and up again, when he rises-- The GENTLEMAN is standing right behind him! Todd turns. The Gentleman's face is completely impassive. He is not spectral. He does not disappear. He just stands there. Todd looks at him. Then the Gentleman's eyes slowly move to a counter... Todd follows his look to see... His largest razor. A long beat as Todd looks at the razor. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 34   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His hands were quick, his fingers strong. It stung a little but not for long. The dashing Oxford Student is now leaning against a wall, arms folded, looking at Todd...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And those who thought him a simple clod Were soon reconsidering under the sod... The Tourist stands by the window...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Consigned there with a friendly prod From Sweeney Todd, The Demon Barber of Fleet Street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: See your razor gleam, Sweeney, Feel how well it fits As it floats across the throats Of hypocrites. The last word echoes to silence as we cut to: A high-angle shot of the room. The ghosts are gone. Todd stands alone over Pirelli's body. Blood dripping from his razor. Drip. Drip. Drip.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 35   INT. OLD BAILEY -- DAY                                        35 Judge Turpin lurks over the proceedings. He sits, the personification of power, very high at the bench. He glares down a wasted wretch of a BOY. The Beadle stands next to the boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is the second time, sir, that you have been brought before this bench. Though it is my earnest wish to ever temper justice with mercy, your persistent dedication to a life of crime is an abomination before God and man. He places a black cloth on his head:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I therefore sentence you to hang by the neck until you are dead and may the Lord have mercy on your soul. The wretched boy collapses in sobs. The Beadle is pleased with the verdict. The Judge removes the black cloth and tosses it casually on his desk:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This court is adjourned. 36   EXT. -- STREET -- OUTSIDE THE OLD BAILEY -- DAY               36 The Judge and the Beadle walk away from the impressive edifices of the Old Bailey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, your Honor. Just the sentence we wanted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was he guilty?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, if he didn't do it, he's surely done something to warrant a hanging.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quietly) What man has not? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 36   CONTINUED:                                                     36 BEADLE Sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No matter -- Come, walk home with me. I have news for you, my friend. In order to shield her from the evils of this world, I have decided to marry my dear Johanna.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, sir, happy news indeed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Strange, though, when I offered myself to her she showed a certain ... reluctance. The Beadle proceeds with exquisite and obsequious delicacy:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Excuse me, my lord, May I request, my lord, Permission, my lord, to speak? Forgive me if I suggest, my lord, You're looking less than your best, my lord, There's powder upon your vest, my lord. And stubble upon your cheek, And ladies, my lord, are weak. As they round a corner, the Judge feels his chin:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stubble, you say? Perhaps at times I am a little overhasty with my morning ablutions...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fret not though, my lord, I know a place, my lord, A barber, my lord, of skill. Thus armed with a shaven face, my lord, Some eau de cologne to brace my lord And musk to enhance the chase, my lord, You'll dazzle the girl until She bows to your every will.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A barber, eh? Take me to him. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 36   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am honored, my lord. His name is Todd ... Sweeney Todd. And he is the very last word in barberin'. They head off. 37   INT. PIE SHOP -- DAY                                          37 Mrs. Lovett is pouring Toby a glass of gin, not his first. He gulps down the gin between ravenous bites of another meat pie as she nervously glances up to the ceiling, wondering what the hell is going on up there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ought to slow down a bit, lad. It'll go to your head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weaned on the stuff, I was. They used to give it to us at the workhouse, so's we could sleep. Not that you'd ever want to sleep in that place, ma'am. Not with the things wot happen in the dark.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's nice, dear ... I think I'll just pop in on Mr. Todd for a tick. You'll be all right here?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave the bottle. She goes. 38   INT. BARBER SHOP -- DAY                                       38 Mrs. Lovett enters. Todd is methodically cleaning his razor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gawd, the lad is drinking me out of house and home, how long until Pirelli gets back?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He won't be back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. T., you didn't! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 38   CONTINUED:                                                    38 He casually points the razor toward the chest. She lifts the lid and sees Pirelli's body at the bottom of the chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're barking mad! Killing a man wot done you no harm!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He recognized me from the old days. He tried to blackmail me -- half my earnings.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh well, that's a different matter! For a moment there I thought you'd lost your marbles! She looks into the chest again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ooooh! All that blood! Enough to make you come all over gooseflesh, ain't it? Poor bugger. Oh, well. She starts to close the chest, then has an idea. She reaches in and rummages around the body. Pulls out Pirelli's chatelaine purse, then drops the lid of the chest.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three quid! Well, waste not, want not, I always say... (she tucks the purse into her dress) ... Now what are we going to do about the boy?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Send him up. She stops, looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, we don't need to worry about him, he's a simple thing. I'll pawn him off with some story. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 38   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (cold) Send him up, woman.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (quickly) Now, Mr. T., surely one's enough for today. Don't want to indulge yourself, after all ... (she busily starts to straighten up the room) ... 'Sides, I was thinking about hiring a lad to help around the shop, me poor knees not being what they used to be. Todd sighs and moves to his familiar post at the window:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anything you say.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Course we'll have to stock up on the gin, the boy drinks like a Barbary sailor-- Todd suddenly gasps -- a great, shocking intake of breath as his whole body tenses like iron-- Mrs. Lovett spins to him--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Judge. Mrs. Lovett hurries to the window-- Below, they can see the Judge and the Beadle approaching. They see them exchanging a few words and then the Beadle moves off as the Judge approaches the shop-- Todd whispers, his eyes blazing:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Justice ... Justice. Mrs. Lovett gives him a quick kiss and then very quickly leaves. A beat as Todd prepares himself. He turns from the window and looks around the shop, shifting nervously. Now that his great moment of revenge is at hand, he doesn't quite know what to do with himself. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 38   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Todd? Todd slowly turns:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At your service ... An honor to receive your patronage, my lord.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know me, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (a polite bow) Who in this wide world is not familiar with the honored Judge Turpin? The Judge grunts and glances around the shop:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These premises are hardly prepossessing and yet the Beadle tells me you are the most accomplished of all the barbers in the city.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That is gracious of him, sir ... (indicates for the Judge to sit) ... Sit, if you please, sir. Sit. The Judge settles into the parlor chair as music begins...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what may I do for you today, sir? A stylish trimming of the hair? A soothing skin massage?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You see, sir, a man infatuate with love, Her ardent and eager slave. So fetch the pomade and pumice stone And lend me a more seductive tone, (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 38   CONTINUED: (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sprinkling perhaps of French cologne, But first, sir, I think -- a shave.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The closest I ever gave. He whips a sheet over the Judge, then tucks the bib in. The Judge hums, flicking imaginary dust off the sheet; Todd whistles gaily.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're in a merry mood today, Mr. Todd.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mixing lather) 'Tis your delight, sir, catching fire From one man to the next.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: 'Tis true, sir, love can still inspire The blood to pound, the heart leap higher.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What more, what more can man require--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Than love, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More than love, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, sir?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Women.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah yes, women.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty women. The Judge hums jauntily, Todd whistles and starts stropping his razor rhythmically. He then lathers the Judge's face. Still whistling, Todd stands back to survey the Judge, who is now totally relaxed, eyes closed. Todd goes to his razor and picks it up, sings to it gently: (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 38   CONTINUED: (5)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now then, my friend. Now to your purpose. Patience, enjoy it. Revenge can't be taken in haste.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (opening his eyes) Make haste, and if we wed, You'll be commended, sir.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My lord... (Goes to him) And who, may it be said, Is your intended, sir?
