direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My ward. A shocked tremor through Todd -- as the Judge closes his eyes again and settles in comfortably...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And pretty as a rosebud. The music rises...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty as her mother?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (mildly puzzled) What? What was that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, nothing, sir. Nothing. May we proceed? The music builds as he steps behind the Judge-- his razor ready -- we are sure the great moment has come -- the music still builds -- Todd finally puts the razor at the Judge's throat-- Then-- With an easy flick of his wrist, he just begins to shave the Judge, as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty women... Fascinating... Sipping coffee, Dancing... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 38   CONTINUED: (6)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty women Are a wonder. Pretty women. Sitting in the window or Standing on the stair, Something in them Cheers the air. Pretty women...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silhouetted...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay within you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Glancing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stay forever...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Breathing lightly...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty women...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty women! Blowing out their candles or Combing out their hair... They sing simultaneously:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then they leave... Even when they leave you And vanish, they somehow Can still remain There with you, There with you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even when they leave, They still Are there. They're there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, Pretty women... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 38   CONTINUED: (7)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At their mirrors...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In their gardens...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Letter-writing...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Flower-picking...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Weather-watching...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How they make a man sing! Proof of heaven As you're living-- Pretty women, sir! The music approaches a feverish crescendo as Todd prepares to finally kill the Judge and they sing simultaneously:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty   women, yes! Pretty   women, sir! Pretty   women! Pretty   women, sir!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty women, here's to Pretty women, all the Pretty women-- Just as the music reaches a climax, Todd raises his arm in a huge arc and is about to slash the Judge's throat when-- Suddenly-- Anthony bursts in--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Todd! I've seen Johanna! She said she'll leave with me tonight--! The Judge jumps up, away from Todd--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You! -- There is indeed a higher power to warn me thus in time-- He tears off the sheet as he advances savagely on Anthony: (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 38   CONTINUED: (8)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Johanna elope with you? Deceiving slut! -- I'll lock her up in some obscure retreat where neither you nor any other vile creature shall ever lay eyes on her again--! He spins with venom to Todd:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And as for you, barber, it is all too clear what company you keep. Service them well and hold their custom -- for you'll have none of mine. He strides out. Todd stands, frozen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Todd -- you have to help me -- I've talked to Johanna and--! Todd suddenly turns on him with a ferocious ROAR:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! OUT, I SAY! Utterly stunned at his friend's ferocity, Anthony backs away, leaves the shop. Music begins, very agitated, as Todd stands motionless. In shock. His mind cracking apart. Mrs. Lovett hurries in:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All this shouting and running about, what's happened--?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had him -- and then--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sailor busted in, I know, I saw them both running down the street and I said-- Todd interrupts wildly: (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 38   CONTINUED: (9)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I had him! His throat was bare Beneath my hand--!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There, there, dear. Don't fret--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (spins on her violently) No, I had him! His throat was there, And he'll never come again!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Easy now. Hush, love, hush. I keep telling you--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's your rush?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did I wait? You told me to wait! Now he'll never come again... The music becomes ferocious as Todd's wrenching insanity, always close to the surface, finally explodes:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a hole in the world Like a great black pit And it's filled with people Who are filled with shit And the vermin of the world Inhabit it-- But not for long! He suddenly looks to Mrs. Lovett -- she starts back -- alarmed by the pure madness in his eyes--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They all deserve to die! Tell you why, Mrs. Lovett, Tell you why: Because in all of the whole human race, Mrs. Lovett There are two kinds of men and only two. There's the one staying put In his proper place (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 38   CONTINUED: (10)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And the one with his foot In the other one's face-- Look at me, Mrs. Lovett, Look at you-- He suddenly lurches and grabs Mrs. Lovett tightly--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, we all deserve to die! Even you, Mrs. Lovett, Even I. Because the lives of the wicked should be-- (slashes at the air violently) Made brief. For the rest of us, death Will be a relief-- We all deserve to die! He clutches her to him very tightly as he suddenly keens, a howl of pure agony:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I'll never see Johanna, No, I'll never hug my girl to me-- He hurls Mrs. Lovett away from him--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finished! We suddenly slash to-- 39   EXT. STREET -- DAY                                            39 --In Todd's mind. We are moving with him as he stalks relentlessly, holding his razor, striding down a busy street like a tiger. The many pedestrians he passes don't even notice him. He is invisible to them, a wolf among the sheep, as he beckons--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: All right! You, sir, How about a shave? Come and visit Your good friend, Sweeney--!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 40   EXT. ANOTHER STREET -- DAY                                 40 Todd continues to stride, beckoning to another man:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You, sir, too, sir-- Welcome to the grave! I will have vengeance, I will have salvation! 41   EXT. ANOTHER STREET -- DAY                                 41 Todd continues to stride, beckoning to another man:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who, sir? You, sir? No one's in the chair-- Come on, come on, Sweeney's waiting! I want you bleeders! 42   EXT. ANOTHER STREET -- DAY                                 42 Todd continues to stride, beckoning to another man:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You, sir -- anybody! Gentlemen, now don't be shy! Not one man, no, Nor ten men, Nor a hundred Can assuage me-- I will have you! 43   EXT. ANOTHER STREET -- DAY                                 43 Todd continues to prowl...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And I will get him back Even as he gloats. In the meantime I'll practice On less honorable throats-- 44   EXT. ANOTHER STREET -- DAY                                 44 Todd suddenly falls to his knees, keening in anguish--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And my Lucy lies in ashes And I'll never see my girl again, But the work waits, I'm alive at last (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 44   CONTINUED:                                                   44 (a final exalted cry) And I'm full of JOOOOOOY!! He raises his razor high on the soaring last note as we pull back ... our view is suddenly obscured by a strange, frenzied fluttering of black wings ... We continue to pull back ... We discover the black wings are pigeons, thousands of them, flying up in a great cloud... We continue to pull back to finally discover that Todd is kneeling in the heart of a church square... Empty but for him. As his cry ends we slash back to-- 45   INT. BARBER SHOP -- DAY                                      45 -- Todd is kneeling, sweat pouring through his clothes, panting for air. Mrs. Lovett stands, looking down at him intently.

Johanna, wearing traveling clothes, is packing to leave when a voice surprises her:

direction.raw_text: So it's true. She turns. The Judge stands in the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sir ... A gentlemen knocks before entering a lady's room.

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 49   CONTINUED:                                                    49 JUDGE When you have learned to appreciate what you have, perhaps we shall meet again. Until then ... Think on your sins. He nods to the Beadle -- the Beadle surges forward and grabs Johanna brutally-- She screams and fights like a tiger -- to no avail-- The Beadle covers her mouth with one of his huge hands and hauls her out-- 50   EXT. TURPIN'S MANSION -- EVENING                               50 Anthony is racing toward the front of mansion when he sees-- A hansom cab is just pulling away -- Johanna's terrified face looking at him through the window--

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ?! HERE I STAND! Anthony's eyes burn into the Judge -- but he is no killer. He turns and races after the hansom cab. It rounds a corner and is gone. The Judge watches as Anthony pursues the cab, disappearing around the corner. And we fade to... 51   EXT. FLEET STREET -- DAY                                       51 ...The face of the Beggar Woman. (CONTINUED)

direction.raw_text: . 51   CONTINUED:                                                    51 She sits, crouched on her haunches, peering up from under her few greasy locks of hair. She is watching something intently. A few pedestrians move quickly down the sidewalk past her, excited. They chatter back and forth eagerly... The Beggar Woman uncoils and follows... And we finally see what the Beggar Woman has been watching so intently... 52   EXT. PIE SHOP -- DAY                                          52 Mrs. Lovett's wretched establishment has been transformed! She has created a modest outdoor eating garden with tables, surrounded by glowing Chinese lanterns. A fresh coat of paint, a few bushes in pots and birds in cages add to the feeling of upward mobility. A new sign hangs proudly over the entrance to the pie shop: "MRS. LOVETT'S WORLD FAMOUS MEAT PIES!" And then in smaller letters: "LIKE MOTHER USED TO MAKE." The eating garden is already crowded, the benches at the tables are filled and other customers stand and mill about. All eating, eating, eating... ...The most delicious looking meat pies you could ever imagine. Crispy crust. Thick, luxurious gravy. Tart and tangy meat. The customers take great, hungry mouthfuls; the steaming gravy oozing down greedy faces. Chomp. Chomp. Chomp. The Beggar Women stands across the street, ravenously hungry. She finally gets the nerve to approach when-- Toby -- wearing a spiffy new outfit with apron -- bursts from the shop and circulates through the customers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ladies and gentlemen, May I have your attention, perlease? Are your nostrils aquiver and tingling as well At that delicate, luscious ambrosial smell? Yes they are, I can tell... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

There you'll sample Mrs. Lovett's meat pies, Savory and sweet pies, As you'll see. You who eat pies, Mrs. Lovett's meat pies Conjure up the treat pies Used to be! Just then Mrs. Lovett sweeps from the pie shop with a tray of hot, steaming pies. Like her shop, she has been transformed as well. She wears her somewhat gauche notion of a "fancy dress." Buckets of decolletage. And her hair has been dyed a rather unique aubergine color.

PIE SHOP -- EVENING                                      106 Todd and Mrs. Lovett are hurrying down the stairs from the barber shop, urgent. Todd has a razor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... I got him locked in -- but if he escapes he'll go to the law!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then he can't escape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. T. -- I don't know -- maybe we could--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Judge will be here soon! I have no time, woman! Come on--! They turn a corner and walk straight into-- The Beadle! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 106   CONTINUED:                                                   106 MRS. LOVETT Excuse me, sir! -- You gave me a fright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not my intention, good madam, though I am here on official business. (elaborately prepares a pinch of snuff) You see, there's been complaints. About the stink from your chimney. They say at night, it's something most foul. Health regulations -- and the general public welfare, naturally -- being my duty, I'm afraid I'll have to take a look ... (inhales the snuff, Sneezes and daintily wipes his nose) ... at your bakehouse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course ... But first why don't you come upstairs and let me attend to you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Much as I do appreciate tonsorial adornment, I really ought see to my "official" obligations first.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An admirable sentiment -- But I must ask you, out of professional curiosity you understand, is that a cream or a tallow pomade?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, not a pomade at all! Me secret is a touch of ambergris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But, sir, hair that delicate requires a genuine pomade! Come along, let me show you the difference.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well ... you are the expert in these matters... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 106   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And we'll finish you off with a nice facial rub of bay rum.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oooh, bay rum is bracing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And all on the house, for my friend, Beadle Bamford.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, sir, I take that very kindly ... Lead on.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am, sir, entirely at your -- (his eyes flit to Mrs. Lovett)
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Then the bell rings outside the shop ... Todd turns ... the Gentleman is gone ... we hear footsteps climbing the stairs... Mrs. Lovett remains standing, her hand out to him, as-- Anthony enters, absolutely exhausted.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Todd immediately hurls himself into a chair and begins writing a letter, his violent scrawl slashing across the page.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: disposal. He leads the Beadle away. Mrs. Lovett allows herself a breath. 107   EXT. PIE SHOP -- EVENING                                   107 From across the street, we see Todd leading the Beadle up the stairs to the barber shop, chatting with him easily. We realize we are seeing the perspective of the Beggar Woman, hunched across the street, watching them closely. 108   INT. BAKEHOUSE -- EVENING                                  108 Toby is eating a pie as he slowly wanders around the bakehouse. He stops to consider the many stained cleavers and bone saws, curious. Then he bites on something hard -- stops -- he reaches into his mouth and pulls something out. Looks at it: It is a fingernail. To be exact, it is the severed tip of a finger. Toby drops it in horror and starts back-- Suddenly, a loud THUMPING and CLANGING makes him spin, alarmed-- (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 108   CONTINUED:                                                    108 As -- The bloody body of the Beadle EXPLODES SUDDENLY from the mouth of the chute-- Toby screams and races to the door-- Pulls at it. Locked. No use. He bangs on the heavy iron door wildly:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LOVETT! MRS. LOVETT! LET ME OUT!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LOVETT! The thundering roar from the bake oven seems to rise to match his frenzy as-- In panic, Toby races to the sewer grate, yanks it up and disappears down into the sewers as the shrill factory whistle SCREAMS and we cut to-- 109   INT. BARBER SHOP -- EVENING                                   109 Todd stands by the chair, his razor high-- His eyes blazing-- His face covered in a spray of blood-- Lost in rapture. Not for long. The Gentleman, the Banker, the General move into the frame with purpose, impatient. The Gentleman flicks out his handkerchief and begins to clean the blood off Todd's face -- he is not gentle, the blood smears--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The engine roared, the motor hissed, And who could see how the road would twist...? Meanwhile, the Banker pulls off Todd's stained barber tunic and hands Todd his jacket--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In Sweeney's ledger the entries matched: A Beadle arrived, and a Beadle dispatched... Meanwhile, the General is cleaning up the blood on the barber chair-- (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 109   CONTINUED:                                                       109 GENERAL To satisfy the hungry god Of Sweeney Todd...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Demon Barber of Fleet... SUDDENLY -- a sharp cry from across the room -- Todd spins--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...Street! Todd sees that more and more of the ghastly specters are moving around the room -- multiplying exponentially -- we see the TOURIST, the STUDENT, the PRIEST and others. They are more intrusive than they have ever been -- touching Todd -- eagerly preparing him for the finale of his drama -- GHOSTS (variously) Sweeney! Sweeney! Sweeney! Sweeney! Sweeney! By now the ghosts are fully Furies, demented and threatening--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sweeney! Sweeeeeeneeeeey...! The screeching music transforms into a strange symphony of inarticulate moans and howls and chants, taking us to... 110   INT. SEWERS -- NIGHT                                              110 GHOSTS (V.O.) Sweeeeeeeeeeeeeeneeeeeeeeeeeey... Sweeneysweeneysweeneysweeney... Todd and Mrs. Lovett are searching for Toby through a horrible catacomb of decaying sewers. Todd carries a razor. Their voices echo bizarrely:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toby! Where are you, love?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toby! Where are you, lad? (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 110   CONTINUED:                                                   110 MRS. LOVETT Nothing's gonna harm you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toby!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not while I'm around...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toby!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing's gonna harm you, Darling...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing to be afraid of boy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not while I'm around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toby...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Demons are prowling everywhere Nowadays...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Toby... Music takes us to... 111   INT. BARBER SHOP -- NIGHT                                     111 Anthony and Johanna hurry into the barber shop. She is now dressed as a scruffy boy, a cap hiding her hair. She is distracted and disturbed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Todd...? No matter. You wait for him here -- I'll return with the coach in less than half an hour... She gently touches Todd's collection of razors...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't worry, darling, in those clothes, no one will recognize you ... You're safe now. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 111   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She picks up the largest razor, looks at it, an eerie echo of her father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Safe ... So we run away and then all our dreams come true?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hope so...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I have never had dreams. Only nightmares.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Johanna ... When we're free of this place all the ghosts will go away. She looks at him very intensely:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, Anthony, they never go away. He gently touches her face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be right back to you ... Half an hour and we'll be free. He goes. She turns to the window, watches him go. Her expression is sad: he will never fully comprehend her depth. Then she sees the Beggar Woman approaching from across the street... 112   EXT. PIE SHOP -- NIGHT                                       112 The Beggar Woman begins climbing the stairs to the barber shop:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beadle ... Beadle ... No good hiding, I saw you! Are you in there still? 113   INT. BARBER SHOP -- NIGHT                                    113 Johanna hears the Beggar Woman singing, climbing the stairs. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 113   CONTINUED:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beadle ... Beadle... Johanna looks around urgently, sees the large chest. She quickly climbs into it and shuts the lid as-- The Beggar Woman enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beadle dear, Beadle... The room has a strange effect on her, as if she were vaguely recalling some distant dream. She intones to pretty lullaby music...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Beadle deedle deedle deedle deedle dumpling, Beadle, dumpling, Be-deedle dumpling... SUDDENLY-- Without warning -- like a thunderbolt -- Todd leaps into the room--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What are you doing here?!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah, evil is here, sir. The stink of evil -- from below -- from her! ... (calling) ... Beadle dear, Beadle! He looks anxiously out the window for the Judge:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be quiet, woman!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's the Devil's wife! Oh, beware her, sir. She with no pity ... (slowing, looking at him more closely) ...in her heart...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Out of here! Now! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 113   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, don't I know you, mister? Todd suddenly sees -- the Judge! -- walking toward the shop-- Todd has no time--! The music THUNDERS as-- In one brutal motion -- he swings around and grabs his razor - - fiercely SLASHES her throat -- tosses her in the chair -- pulls the lever -- she slides through the floor-- He pulls the chair back to its normal position just as-- The Judge enters.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is she? Where's the girl?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Below, your Honor. With my neighbor. Thank heavens the sailor did not molest her. Thank heavens, too, she has seen the error of her ways.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She has?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh yes, sir, your lesson was well learned. She speaks only of you, longing for forgiveness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then she shall have it. She'll be here soon, you say? The music builds, the pace increases:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I hear her now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, excellent, my friend!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is that her dainty footstep on the stair?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I hear nothing. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 113   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, isn't that her shadow on the wall?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There! Primping, Making herself even prettier than usual--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Even prettier...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If possible.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ohhhhhhh, Pretty women!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty women, yes...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Quickly, sir, a splash of bay rum!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit, sir, sit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Johanna, Johanna... Todd gets a towel, puts it carefully around the Judge, moves to get a bottle of bay rum--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty women...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hurry, man!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty women Are a wonder... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 113   CONTINUED: (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're in a merry mood again today, barber.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty women!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What we do for They sing simultaneously as Todd smoothes bay rum on the Judge's face and then reaches for his razor:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty women! Blowing out their candles Combing out their hair-- Then they leave-- Even when they leave you And vanish, they somehow Can still remain There with you there...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pretty women! Blowing out their candles Or combing out their hair, Even when they leave, They still Are there, They're there... The music builds dangerously as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How seldom it is one meets a fellow spirit!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With fellow tastes -- in women, at least.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What? What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The years no doubt have changed me, sir. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 113   CONTINUED: (5)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But then, I suppose the face of a barber -- the face of a prisoner in the dock -- is not particularly memorable.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Benjamin Barker!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ! The factory whistle screams a steady, terrible blast as-- Todd brutally SLASHES the Judge's throat-- Severing his jugular-- The spray of blood drenches Todd-- He pulls the lever and sends the body tumbling out of sight down the chute. The music continues... As Todd stands for a long moment, blood dripping from his face, exalted. Then he sinks to his knees, overcome. The music stops. A long beat of silence. Then Todd looks at his razor deeply:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rest now, my friend, Rest now forever, Sleep now the untroubled Sleep of the angels. Then silence as he reverently sets the razor on the floor and looks at it. We focus on his face. His quest is completed. His demons silenced. The ghosts are gone. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 113   CONTINUED: (6)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's done. He just kneels there. No reason to move. No purpose in life. Then... A sound from the chest. A slight thump. His eyes dart to the chest. He slowly picks up his razor and moves to the chest. Then suddenly WRENCHES it open and HAULS out Johanna--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come for a shave, have you, lad?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No -- I... He tosses her in the chair, throws back his arm, his razor ready--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Surely, yes! Everyone needs a good shave--! SUDDENLY -- A PIERCING SCREAM ECHOES UP FROM THE CHUTE -- Mrs. Lovett's voice -- screaming to raise the dead-- Todd rivets Johanna, pointing the razor at her, a lethal warning:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Forget my face. He spins and bolts out of the shop, leaving her sitting in the chair-- 114   INT. BAKEHOUSE -- NIGHT                                      114 Mrs. Lovett is standing in horror by the mouth of the chute. The Judge, still barely alive, clutches at her skirt-- She tries to wrench herself away from his vise-like grip--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Die! Die! God in heaven -- die! The Judge's fingers finally relax their grip; he is dead. Panting, Mrs. Lovett, backs away from him and for the first time notices the body of the Beggar Woman. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 114   CONTINUED:                                                   114 MRS. LOVETT You! Can it be? Have all the demons of Hell come to torment me?! She grabs the Beggar Woman and starts dragging her quickly toward the oven as Todd races in:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why did you scream? Does the Judge live still?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He was clutching, holding on to my dress, but he's finished now... She continues quickly dragging the Beggar Woman toward the oven.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Leave them to me. Open the doors. He waves her toward the oven--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No! Don't touch her!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Open the doors! He shoves her toward the oven and leans over to pick up the Beggar Woman's body--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the matter with you? It's only a silly old beggar-- Then -- Mrs. Lovett opens the oven doors-- The thundering roar from the oven crashes through the room as the fiery light slashes across the floor-- Clearly illuminating the face of the Beggar Woman. A chord of music as Todd realizes who she is. Music continues and builds as:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh no! ... Oh God ... "Don't I know you?" she said ... He looks up to Mrs. Lovett: (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 114   CONTINUED: (2)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You knew she lived. From the moment that I came into your shop you knew my Lucy lived!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I was only thinking of you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking down again) Lucy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Your Lucy! A crazy hag picking bones and rotten spuds out of alley ashcans! Would you have wanted to know she ended up like that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (looking up) You lied to me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (desperately) No, no, not lied at all. No, I never lied.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: (to Beggar Woman) Lucy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Said she took the poison -- she did -- Never said that she died -- Poor thing, She lived--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've come home again...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But it left her weak in the head, All she did for months was just lie there in bed--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Should've been in hospital, Wound up in Bedlam instead, Poor thing! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 114   CONTINUED: (3)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, my God...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Better you should think she was dead. (passionately) Yes, I lied 'cos I love you!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lucy...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd be twice the wife she was! I love you! Could that thing have cared for you Like me?
direction.name: direction

result.heading: SUDDENLY -- A PIERCING SCREAM ECHOES UP FROM THE CHUTE --

direction.raw_text: ?! Todd's eyes suddenly snap up to Mrs. Lovett -- as the glorious "Little Priest" waltz theme returns--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mrs. Lovett, You're a bloody wonder, Eminently practical and yet Appropriate as always, As you've said repeatedly, There's little point in dwelling on the past. He steps toward her, she steps back, unsure, as they sing simultaneously:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, come here, my love... Not a thing to fear, My love... What's dead Is dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you mean it? Everything I did I swear I thought Was only for the best, Believe me! (a heartbreaking plea) Can we still be Married? Todd steps toward her darkly. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 114   CONTINUED: (4)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She knows she is doomed. But steps into his arms anyway for a final, triumphant waltz:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The history of the world, my pet--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, Mr. Todd, Ooh, Mr. Todd, Leave it to me...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Is learn forgiveness and try to forget.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By the sea, Mr. Todd, We'll be comfy-cozy, By the sea, Mr. Todd, Where there's no one nosy... He waltzes her toward the roaring oven. She offers no resistance, fully aware of what's coming. The blazing, thundering inferno of the oven makes it seem they are the damned, dancing through Hell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And life is for the alive, my dear, So let's keep living it--!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just keep living it, Really living it--! The music reaches a thundering crescendo as-- He flings her into the oven and slams the doors-- We hear her screaming. And banging on the oven doors. Todd sinks to his knees and covers his ears desperately as the banging and screaming and music finally fade to silence. Then he slowly drags himself across the floor to the Beggar Woman. He cradles her head in his arms. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 114   CONTINUED: (5)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There was a barber and his wife, And she was beautiful. A foolish barber and his wife, She was his reason and his life. And she was beautiful. And she was virtuous. And he was... Todd folds himself over his dead wife. The only sound his deep, anguished sobs. A long beat. Then he becomes aware of something. He looks over to see.... Toby -- staring at him from the open sewer grate. He has seen everything. Todd watches as Toby silently pulls himself up. Todd gently sets Lucy down and then, still kneeling, turns to face Toby. A long beat as they look at each other. Then Toby slowly moves and carefully picks up Todd's razor. Todd looks at him. Then slowly unbuttons his collar and exposes his neck. He bends his head back, offering his naked throat. Toby slowly goes to him and methodically slits his throat. Todd continues to gaze up at Toby as we hear the lonely sound of wind escaping from his severed wind pipe. Then Toby turns and leaves the bakehouse. Todd leans forward, dying. We cut to his point-of-view: The rough brick floor... From the bottom of the frame... A dark pool of blood slowly begins to spread ... moving up the frame ... the fiery glow from the bake oven reflected in the blood... (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 114   CONTINUED: (6)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Finally, the pool of blood fills the entire frame. We realize this is the first image we saw in the story. Todd's perspective. Todd's blood. As he dies. As before, the Gentleman's face appears, reflected in the pool of blood...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd, His skin was pale and his eye was odd. The Banker emerges from the shadows of the bakehouse...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He shaved the faces of gentlemen Who never thereafter were heard of again. The General emerges ... and the Tourist ... and the Priest ... and the Student...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He trod a path that few have trod, Did Sweeney Todd, The Demon Barber of Fleet Street. Then a new ghost ... a face we recognize ... the Beggar Woman...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He kept a shop in London town, Of fancy clients and good renown. She is joined by the Judge...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what if none of their souls were saved? They went to their maker impeccably shaved.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: By Sweeney, By Sweeney Todd, The Demon Barber of Fleet Street. The Beadle and Pirelli join the ghosts...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Swing your razor wide, Sweeney! Hold it to the skies! Freely flows the blood of those Who moralize! (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 114   CONTINUED: (7)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ghosts move around the bakehouse, considering the meat grinder and stained cleavers and chopping block...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His needs are few, his room is bare. He hardly uses his fancy chair. The more he bleeds, the more he lives. He never forgets and he never forgives. Perhaps today you gave a nod To Sweeney Todd. The Demon Barber of Fleet Street. Hunting like predators, we begin to move urgently through the ghosts. Their long shadows tower bizarrely against the walls and ceiling of the bakehouse. The fiery red roar of the bake oven builds in intensity...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sweeney wishes the world away, Sweeney's weeping for yesterday, Hugging the blade, waiting the years, Hearing the music that nobody hears. Sweeney waits in the parlor hall, Sweeney leans on the office wall. No one can help, nothing can hide you-- Isn't that Sweeney there beside you? Sweeney wishes the world away, Sweeney's weeping for yesterday, Is Sweeney! There he is, it's Sweeney! Sweeney! Sweeney! We tear through them with increasing frenzy -- cutting quickly, vertiginous angles -- as the music builds--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There! There! There! There! There! There! There! (almost a scream now) There! They move away-- Revealing-- Todd and Mrs. Lovett. Facing each other. We circle them: (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . 114   CONTINUED: (8)
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Attend the tale of Sweeney Todd! He served a dark and a hungry god!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To seek revenge may lead to hell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But everyone does it, if seldom as well--
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: --As Sweeney...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As Sweeney Todd... The Demon Barber of Fleet... The ghosts begin to disappear ... fading into the shadows of the bakehouse ... leaving Todd and Mrs. Lovett alone...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... Street! The febrile music continues as Todd and Mrs. Lovett stand alone, continuing to glare at each other. Finally she gives him a grim little smile and disappears into the darkness. He stands alone. And we cut to-- A series of images from earlier in our story, cut to the music -- Todd's life flashing before his eyes -- The images building as the music races toward its conclusion-- Todd singing -- slashing -- smiling -- striding-- The final crash of music at the final image: Todd kneeling, hunched over the pool of blood on the bakehouse floor. He falls... Into the blood. Dead. (CONTINUED)
direction.name: direction
